summary: After extensive searching through multiple API endpoints and search patterns, no significant LoL or Dota2 esports markets with substantial trading volume were found on Polymarket.

search_attempts.result: No markets returned or wrong markets returned
Returned non-esports markets (mostly 2020 election markets where search terms appeared)
Returned data but no clear esports markets with significant volume

conclusion: Polymarket may not currently have (or may have recently removed) LoL and Dota2 esports markets with significant trading volume. Possible reasons:
possible_reasons: Polymarket focuses primarily on politics, crypto, and mainstream sports rather than esports
Esports markets exist but have very low volume (<$100 total)
Markets use different categorization/tagging that doesn't match search patterns
Esports markets may be under a different API endpoint not explored
Historical esports markets may have been archived or removed from public APIs
alternative_approaches: Check Counter-Strike (CS:GO/CS2) markets which were found in earlier API responses
Check if Polymarket has a dedicated esports subdomain or separate platform
Review recent Polymarket blog/announcements for esports market offerings
note: Unable to provide wallet analysis without actual LoL/Dota2 market data with sufficient trading activity
